title: Jamaica declares disaster as ‘Monstrous Melissa’ ravages island
summary: Prime minister expects 'loss of life' after powerful hurricane damages homes, hospitals and inundates parishes.

title: Fears of mass atrocities after Sudan’s el-Fasher falls to paramilitaries
summary: Paramilitaries seize el-Fasher amid reports of mass killings and fears Sudan’s humanitarian crisis is deepening.

title: Polls open in Tanzania’s election as key opponents barred
summary: President Samia Suluhu Hassan is expected to win the election as the two main opposition parties have been barred.

title: Dutch vote in knife-edge snap elections seen as litmus test for far right
summary: Polls suggest anti-Islam lawmaker Geert Wilders and his Freedom Party on course to win largest number of seats.

title: Trump says he expects ‘great deal’ with China at summit with Xi
summary: US and Chinese leaders are expected to sign a trade deal in their first meeting since 2019.

title: Tanzania elections: Who’s standing and what’s at stake?
summary: Opposition members accuse President Samia Suluhu Hassan of cracking down on dissent to stay in power.

title: Why is New Delhi making it rain artificially?
summary: Delhi is using 'cloud seeding' in a bid to dispel pollution - but can it work?

title: LIVE: Australia vs India – first T20 international
summary: Follow our live build-up, with toss and team news, in the run-up to our full text commentary stream of Canberra's series opener.

title: ‘Horrific violations’: Arab nations slam RSF killings in Sudan’s el-Fasher
summary: Regional countries express alarm as more evidence emerges of mass killings by paramilitary forces in el-Fasher.

title: LIVE: Israel kills 90 in Gaza; Trump insists nothing will jeopardise truce
summary: Among the dead are at least 24 children as Israeli military says one of its soldiers killed.

title: Carlos Alcaraz suffers shock loss to Cameron Norrie at Paris Masters
summary: Cameron Norrie rallied from a set down to record the biggest win of his career against world number 1 Carlos Alcaraz.

title: Guerrero Jr, Blue Jays smash Dodgers in Game 4 to even World Series
summary: Vladimir Guerrero Jr's two-run homer allows Toronto Blue Jays to draw level with LA Dodgers in best-of-seven series.

title: Gaza en direct : Israël dit "reprendre le cessez-le-feu" après des frappes ayant fait au moins 70 morts
summary: La Défense civile et les autorités sanitaires à Gaza ont annoncé mercredi la mort d'au moins 70 Palestiniens, dont 22 enfants, dans des bombardements israéliens. Israël dit reprendre le cessez-le-feu après ces frappes. Malgré ces violences, le président Donald Trump a assuré que "rien" ne compromettrait l'accord de cessez-le-feu qu'il a négocié entre Israël et le Hamas. Suivez notre direct.

title: Israël lance des frappes sur Gaza, le Hamas dément toute attaque sur les troupes israéliennes
summary: Israël a mené des frappes meurtrières dans la bande de Gaza, mardi, entrainant la mort d'au moins 30 personnes, selon La Défense civile opérant sous l'autorité du Hamas. Plus tôt, Benjamin Netanyahu a accusé le Hamas de violer la trêve. Ce dernier dément toute attaque sur des soldats israéliens et "réaffirme son engagement envers l'accord de cessez-le-feu".

title: Gaza : la dernière restitution de dépouille d'otage met le cessez-le-feu en péril, selon Israël
summary: Au lendemain de la restitution par le Hamas d'une dépouille d'otage israélien, Israël affirme mardi que ces "restes humains" appartiennent déjà à un corps d'otage rendu. Et accuse le groupe islamiste palestinien de violation de leur accord de cessez-le-feu dans la bande de Gaza.

title: Liban : l'ONU et la France dénoncent des tirs israéliens près de Casques bleus de la Finul
summary: L'ONU et la France affirment qu'un drone israélien a largué, dimanche au Liban, une grenade à proximité d'une patrouille de la Finul. Elles accusent également un char israélien d'avoir tiré sur des Casques bleus. Israël explique avoir riposté après que les forces de la Finul ont abattu un de ses drones de renseignement.

title: Liban : désarmement du Hezbollah, frappes israéliennes et drones
summary: Serge Berberi, notre correspondant à Beyrouth, analyse la situation.

title: Gaza : l'armée israélienne annonce avoir reçu un cercueil contenant le corps d'un seizième otage
summary: Le bureau du Premier ministre israélien a affirmé, lundi soir, que le Hamas a restitué le corps d'un seizième otage mort dans la bande de Gaza. Quelques heures auparavant, les familles des otages avaient appelé à suspendre les prochaines étapes de l'accord de cessez-le-feu si toutes les dépouilles n'étaient pas rendues.

title: Gaza : la Croix-Rouge, le Hamas et une équipe égyptienne cherchent des corps d'otages, selon Israël
summary: La Croix-Rouge, une personne du Hamas et une équipe égyptienne participent lundi à des recherches pour retrouver des dépouilles d'otages détenus depuis l'attaque du 7 octobre 2023 dans la bande de Gaza. Autorisées à pénétrer "au-delà de la "ligne jaune", les équipes de recherche agissent "sous la supervision étroite de l'armée israélienne", selon la porte-parole du gouvernement israélien.

title: Guerre à Gaza : quelle force de stabilisation ?
summary: Claire Duhamel, correspondante France24 à Jérusalem, décrypte la situation.

title: Karin Huster : "Gaza, un summum de destruction unique dans l'expérience de beaucoup d'humanitaires"
summary: Deux semaines après la mise en œuvre du cessez-le-feu à Gaza, l'aide humanitaire qui entre dans l'enclave est toujours insuffisante au regard de l'ampleur des besoins et alors qu'une grande partie de la population a été touchée par la famine. Outre les 68 000 morts, près de 170 000 personnes ont été blessées ; parmi elles, 15 000 ont besoin d'être évacuées d'urgence selon l'OMS. Témoignage depuis al-Mawasi de Karin Huster, responsable des activités médicales de Médecins sans frontières.

title: Gaza : l'armée israélienne affirme avoir mené une frappe aérienne contre le Jihad islamique
summary: L'armée israélienne a indiqué, samedi soir, avoir mené une frappe aérienne dans le centre de la bande de Gaza en dépit du cessez-le-feu en vigueur. Elle visait, selon elle, un membre du Jihad islamique.

title: En Israël, Netanyahu va-t-il faire le pari d’une élection anticipée ?
summary: Porté par l’onde de choc de la libération des otages, du cessez-le-feu à Gaza et de la visite triomphale de Donald Trump à Jérusalem, Benjamin Netanyahu va-t-il convoquer des législatives anticipées ? Nombre d’observateurs de la vie politique israélienne penchent en faveur de ce scenario. Le Premier ministre tentera-t-il un ultime coup de poker pour rester au pouvoir ?

title: "Les habitants ne peuvent pas revenir" : Gaza face à la nouvelle "ligne jaune" tracée par Israël
summary: L’armée israélienne a commencé à marquer la "ligne jaune" derrière laquelle elle doit se retirer, conformément au plan de paix signé avec le Hamas. Une ONG juridique israélienne dénonce une "frontière floue" entraînant une "exposition accrue aux tirs" et bloquant l'accès d’une partie de la population aux habitations, terres agricoles et infrastructures civiles.

title: Au Japon, Donald Trump et Sanae Takaichi promettent « un nouvel âge d’or » des relations nippo-américaines
summary: La nouvelle première ministre japonaise, Sanae Takaichi, a été aux petits soins pour Donald Trump lors de leur première rencontre. Ses équipes ont conclu nombre d’accords favorables à l’économie américaine. De quoi conforter une relation bilatérale précieuse pour le Japon.

title: L’ouragan Melissa, rétrogradé en catégorie 3, touche Cuba avec des vents de 195 km/h
summary: En Haïti, les autorités ont ordonné la fermeture des écoles, des commerces et des administrations mercredi. Avant même de toucher terre mardi en Jamaïque, l’ouragan y a fait trois morts, ainsi que trois autres en Haïti et un en République dominicaine.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : les dernières informations
summary: Le président ukrainien, Volodymyr Zelensky, a confirmé mardi dans la soirée que Pokrovsk, dans l’oblast de Donetsk, dans l’est de l’Ukraine, était au cœur des combats avec l’armée russe.

title: EN DIRECT, Gaza : au moins 91 personnes tuées, dont 24 enfants, dans les bombardements israéliens, selon les hôpitaux de l’enclave
summary: Quelque 200 autres personnes ont été blessées dans ces attaques sur les villes de Gaza et Khan Younès, selon la défense civile palestinienne, accusant Israël de « violation claire et flagrante de l’accord de cessez-le-feu ». L’Etat hébreu fait de même avec le Hamas, qu’il accuse d’avoir visé ses soldats.

title: L’ouragan Melissa, un « monstre » avec des vents de 300 km/h, a traversé la Jamaïque et sème la désolation dans les Caraïbes
summary: Après avoir causé des inondations meurtrières en République dominicaine et à Haïti, ce phénomène cyclonique se dirige désormais vers Cuba et les Bahamas.

title: En Espagne, un an après les inondations meurtrières à Valence, la colère et l’inquiétude permanente des habitants
summary: Les pluies torrentielles hors norme qui ont touché la région de Valence le 29 octobre 2024 laissent un traumatisme profond dans la population.

title: Avant sa rencontre avec Donald Trump, Xi Jinping a opté pour la manière forte
summary: Le président chinois pense avoir appris de ses échecs face à son homologue américain, qu’il retrouvera, jeudi, en Corée du Sud. Il a notamment utilisé les terres rares, indispensables dans les nouvelles technologies, comme puissant levier de négociation.

title: L’Observatoire de l’immigration et de la démographie, un think tank qui fabrique de la peur
summary: Complètement absent de la sphère académique, l’organisme, inconnu il y a deux ans, jouit d’une certaine audience dans l’espace public. S’il ne triche pas sur les chiffres, il les met au service d’une vision alarmiste de l’immigration.

title: Israël bombarde la bande de Gaza, fragilisant encore un peu plus l’accord de cessez-le-feu
summary: Au moins 91 personnes sont mortes dans les frappes menées mardi soir par l’Etat hébreu, en réponse à une « attaque » contre des soldats israéliens à Rafah. Le Hamas nie toute responsabilité dans cet échange de tirs et dénonce une violation de l’accord de paix.

title: Pakistan-Afghanistan : Islamabad rapporte que les négociations pour une trêve entre les deux pays voisins ont échoué
summary: Alors que la frontière est toujours fermée et que les tensions restent vives, le Pakistan brandit la menace d’une « guerre ouverte » si aucun compromis n’est trouvé avec Kaboul.

title: L’ouragan Melissa se dirige vers Cuba et laisse derrière lui une « zone sinistrée » en Jamaïque
summary: Des rafales de l’ouragan, rétrogradé mardi soir en catégorie 4, ont frôlé les 300 km/h et ont détruit plusieurs infrastructures de l’île. Avant même de toucher terre, Melissa avait fait trois morts en Jamaïque, trois en Haïti et un en République dominicaine.

title: La Turquie face au risque de perdre tout un pan de sa jeunesse
summary: Plusieurs rapports ont mis en lumière le décrochage vertigineux de l’enseignement supérieur turc et, en corollaire, celui de toute une génération, un tiers des 18-24 ans n’étant ni employés, ni scolarisés, ni en formation.

title: Israeli strike kills two Palestinians in Deir al-Balah home attack
summary:
Israeli strike kills two Palestinians in Deir al-Balah home attack

At least two Palestinians were killed and several others wounded after an Israeli airstrike hit a house south of Deir al-Balah in central Gaza, a medical source at Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital told Al Jazeera Arabic.

title: Israeli media says Gaza attacks may pause as ceasefire set to resume
summary:
Israeli media says Gaza attacks may pause as ceasefire set to resume

Israel’s Channel 12 has reported that the assault on Gaza is expected to halt, with the ceasefire scheduled to resume at 10am local time.

In a separate report carried by i24NEWS, an unnamed Israeli official claimed that attacks on the Gaza Strip are “nearing their end,” saying Israeli forces had hit dozens of targets and carried out assassinations against what it claimed were Hamas members.

title: In photos: Israeli strikes leave trail of devastation across Gaza
summary: In photos: Israeli strikes leave trail of devastation across Gaza

title: Heavy Israeli bombardment hits Rafah and Khan Younis
summary:
Heavy Israeli bombardment hits Rafah and Khan Younis

Israeli warplanes have carried out intense air raids on the central and northern areas of Rafah in southern Gaza, Al Jazeera Arabic is reporting.

Explosions were heard across the Gaza Strip after strikes east of Gaza City, with the correspondent noting that at least 10 air attacks also hit Khan Younis.

The Israeli occupation army launched dozens of air and artillery strikes from last night through this morning, in what Palestinian officials are calling a flagrant breach of the ceasefire agreement.

title: Israeli forces arrest 11 Palestinians in overnight raids in occupied West Bank
summary:
Israeli forces arrest 11 Palestinians in overnight raids in occupied West Bank

Israeli occupation forces detained 11 Palestinians during pre-dawn raids in the Ramallah and al-Bireh Governorate on Wednesday, according to security sources speaking to Wafa.

Troops stormed the town of Dura al-Qar’a, northeast of Ramallah, and arrested 10 people: the brothers Ahmed and Mahmoud Jamal al-Masri, Islam Radwan, Ahmed Jamal Hassan, Ibrahim Amin, Rami Hassan, Mahmoud Hassan, Farah al-Saadi and his sons Yahya and Amin.

In a separate raid in Beitunia, west of Ramallah, the occupation forces arrested 19-year-old Fares Ahmed Abdel Halim after breaking into his home. His brother was beaten during the raid and taken to hospital for treatment.

title: Death toll in Gaza rises to 90 as Israel intensifies strikes
summary:
Death toll in Gaza rises to 90 as Israel intensifies strikes

Medical sources have told Al Jazeera that at least 90 Palestinians have been killed in the latest Israeli bombardment of Gaza.

Central Gaza has recorded the highest number of fatalities, with 42 people killed, while 31 were confirmed dead in the north and 18 in the south, the figures are expected to rise as people are taken out of the rubble.

title: At least 63 Palestinians killed, including 24 children, in latest Israeli strikes
summary:
At least 63 Palestinians killed, including 24 children, in latest Israeli strikes

In a new wave of attacks across the Gaza Strip, Israeli forces have killed at least 63 Palestinians, including 24 children, medical sources have told Al Jazeera Arabic.

title: Israeli strike kills five Palestinians in Deir al-Balah tent camp
summary:
Israeli strike kills five Palestinians in Deir al-Balah tent camp

A medical source at Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital told Al Jazeera Arabic that at least five Palestinians were killed and several others wounded after an Israeli air strike hit a tent sheltering displaced families in Deir al-Balah in central Gaza.

The attack struck an area where civilians had taken refuge from earlier bombardment, in yet another Israeli assault on locations explicitly designated for displaced people.

title: Morning recap
summary:
Morning recap

Good morning Middle East Eye readers,

Here are the latest updates from Israel's war on Gaza, now in its 753rd day:

  • Israeli forces have bombed multiple areas across Gaza, killing at least 60 Palestinians, shortly after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu ordered what he called “powerful strikes” on the besieged enclave.

  • The escalation followed a gun battle in southern Rafah, where an Israeli soldier was reported wounded.

  • Hamas’s Qassam Brigades accused Israel of breaching the pause in fighting and announced it was delaying the planned transfer of a captive’s body.

  • The group said its fighters had also recovered the bodies of two other Israeli captives, Amiram Cooper and Sahar Baruch, during Tuesday's search operations.

  • Suhail al-Hindi, a senior Hamas political official, told Al Jazeera the group remains committed to the truce and that Israel holds “full responsibility for any delay in recovering the remaining bodies” of captives.

  • US Vice President JD Vance said Washington still considers the ceasefire to be in effect, despite the latest strikes and mutual accusations of violations.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog is now closed until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

- Health officials in Gaza are now reporting the number of dead has exceeded 30 after Israel resumed air strikes across Gaza late Tuesday evening, local time.

- US Vice President JD Vance told reporters "the ceasefire is holding," and "that doesn't mean that there aren't going to be little skirmishes here and there". 

- Suheil al-Hindi, a member of Hamas's political bureau, rejected the Israeli accusation that Hamas is buying time by pretending to search for the remains of captives. He said the group does not benefit from any such action.

- Israel has committed 125 violations of the ceasefire agreement since it came into effect on 10 October, the Gaza government media office said.

- The number of Palestinians killed by Israeli forces in the Gaza Strip since October 2023 has surpassed 68,500, the Palestinian health ministry announced. The majority of those killed are women and children.

title: More than 30 dead after resumption of Israeli air strikes on Gaza
summary:
More than 30 dead after resumption of Israeli air strikes on Gaza

Health officials in Gaza are now reporting the number of dead has exceeded 30 after Israel resumed air strikes across Gaza late Tuesday evening, local time.

title: Gaza ceasefire is holding, US vice president says
summary:
Gaza ceasefire is holding, US vice president says

US Vice President JD Vance said on Tuesday the ceasefire in Gaza was holding despite Israeli strikes in Gaza City and both Israel and Hamas accusing each other of violations.

"The ceasefire is holding. That doesn't mean that there aren't going to be little skirmishes here and there," Vance told reporters. 

"We know that Hamas or somebody else within Gaza attacked an [Israeli military] soldier. We expect the Israelis are going to respond, but I think the President's peace is going to hold despite that."

- Reporting by Reuters

title: Iranian girls’ handball team crowned champions at Asian Youth Games
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iranian girls’ handball team have clinched gold at the Asian Youth Games in Bahrain after securing their fifth consecutive victory, sealing the championship even before the tournament’s final whistle.

title: Gharibabadi: Iran and Afghanistan reach agreement on extradition of Iranian prisoners
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs for Legal and International Affairs Kazem Gharibabadi said based on an understanding between Tehran and Kabul, imprisoned Iranians are to be handed over to the embassy to facilitate their immediate transfer to the country.

title: Iran condemns attacks on civilians in Sudan’s Darfur region
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The Foreign Ministry has expressed deep concern over the ongoing violence in Sudan’s North Darfur region, condemning the killing of civilians and destruction of infrastructure in the city of Al-Fashir.

title: Iran supports Eurasian Security Charter initiative
summary: Minsk, IRNA – Saeed Khatibzadeh, Iran’s Deputy Foreign Minister, has expressed the Islamic Republic’s support for the proposed Eurasian Security Charter during his remarks at the International Conference on Eurasian Security in Minsk.

title: Embargo against Cuba must be lifted immediately, unconditionally: Iran
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran’s ambassador and permanent representative to the United Nations says that the embargo on Cuba must be lifted immediately and without conditions, noting that ending the restrictions would provide much-needed relief to the Cuban people and send a clear message that the era of coercion, domination, and economic oppression must end.

title: Iranian vice president warns enemies not to even think of attacking Iran again
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Vice President Mohammad-Reza Aref has warned the enemies to think twice before renewing their aggression on the country.

title: Gaza media office says Israel has violated ceasefire more than 125 times
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The government media office in Gaza says Israel has carried out more than 125 violations of the ceasefire agreement since it went into effect on October 10, resulting in casualties and damage across the enclave.

title: Israel’s ‘Hasbara’: An effective propaganda tool to muzzle opposing voices
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Israel’s “Hasbara” policy, long considered one of the most sophisticated tools of public diplomacy, has evolved into a vast propaganda machine designed to justify occupation, whitewash war crimes, and suppress dissent.

title: Iraq PM urges respectful engagement with Iran
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iraq’s Prime Minister Mohammed Shia al-Sudani has stressed that Iran is an important and influential neighbor that must be engaged with respectfully through direct dialogue.

title: Iran, Vietnam deputy foreign ministers discuss consular issues
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Deputy Foreign Minister for Consular, Parliamentary and Iranian Expatriates Affairs Vahid Jalalzadeh met with Vietnam’s Deputy Foreign Minister Nguyen Minh Hang in Hanoi to discuss consular matters and bilateral cooperation.

title: Russia supports long-term diplomatic solutions for Iran's nuclear program: Ambassador
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Russian Ambassador to Tehran Alexey Dedov has reaffirmed Moscow's unwavering support for Iran's peaceful nuclear program, emphasizing his country’s support for long-term diplomatic solutions for the Islamic Republic's nuclear program.

title: President Pezeshkian: Iran ready to mediate between Pakistan and Afghanistan
summary: Tehran, IRNA – President Masoud Pezeshkian announced Tehran readiness to mediate between Pakistan and Afghanistan to resolve their disputes.

title: Terrorist cell dismantled in eastern Iran (+VIDEO)
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 29 (MNA) – In a complex and decisive operation, Iranian security forces captured a terrorist cell of the so-called Jaish al-Adl group at their hideout in eastern Iran, following previous attacks on law enforcement officers.

title: Macron plan to send troops to Ukraine political suicide
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 29 (MNA) – French President Emmanuel Macron’s plans to send troops to Ukraine could mark the end of his political career, a US political commentator says.

title: Iran UN envoy urges immediate lifting of Cuba embargo
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 29 (MNA) – Iran’s ambassador and permanent representative to the United Nations says that the embargo on Cuba must be lifted immediately and without conditions.

title: New Japanese FM stresses developing Tehran-Tokyo ties
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 29 (MNA) – Toshimitsu Motegi, Japan’s new Foreign Minister, expressed his commitment to further strengthening the historic and friendly ties between his country and the Islamic Republic of Iran.

title: The jewel of Iran: How pomegranate shapes culture and craft
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 29 (MNA) – From bustling bazaars to festive tables, the pomegranate, or “Anar,” is more than a fruit in Iran; it’s a symbol of tradition, art, and culinary mastery, cherished across generations and celebrated in cities and villages.

title: 'Pretty clear I’m not allowed to run’ for third term
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 29 (MNA) – US President Donald Trump on Wednesday appeared to rule out seeking a third term, acknowledging that the Constitution is “pretty clear” that he is not allowed to run again.

title: 63 killed in renewed Israeli attacks on Gaza
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 29 (MNA) – Hospital sources report that Israeli strikes on various areas of Gaza from last night until this morning have killed 63 people, including 22 children.

title: Lebanon’s prime minister calls for end to Israeli attacks
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 29 (MNA) – Lebanon’s Prime Minister, Nawaf Salam, has urged the cessation of Israeli aggressions against his country, stressing that any negotiations should focus on implementing a ceasefire and the complete withdrawal of Israeli forces.

summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 29 (MNA) – Iraq’s Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) have identified and dismantled a terrorist cell linked to ISIL in the western province of Anbar, according to security sources.

title: Mystery drone downed near US Army base in Eurpoe
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 29 (MNA) – An unidentified drone was shot down near a base housing US troops in southeastern Estonia, close to the Russian border, the Baltic nation’s military has announced.

title: Iran begins test flights of home-made cargo plane
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 29 (MNA) – The Iranian-made plane Simorgh has officially started its test flights as the aircraft prepares to join the country’s cargo fleet.

title: نقش‌آفرینی همراه اول در کاهش ناترازی انرژی با تکیه بر فناوری و داده
summary: در رویداد تراکنش ایران، مدیران همراه اول در نشست «مثلث ناترازی‌ها، نوآوری‌ها و نوفناوری‌ها» بر نقش فناوری و داده در کاهش ناترازی انرژی و توسعه راهکارهای هوشمند تأکید کردند.

title: ۱۸ کشته و ۱۸ مفقود در پی واژگونی قایق در سواحل غربی لیبی
summary: سرویس آمبولانس و اورژانس لیبی روز چهارشنبه اعلام کرد که در مجموع ۱۸ مهاجر پس از واژگونی قایقشان در نزدیکی شهر غربی زاویه کشته، ۹۲ نفر نجات یافته و ۱۸ نفر دیگر مفقود شده‌اند.

title: تحریم‌های داخلی مخرب‌تر از تحریم‌های خارجی هستند
summary: رئیس اتحادیه ابزارآلات با بیان اینکه رشد اقتصاد کشور بدون توجه جدی به صنعت ممکن نیست، گفت: تحریم‌های داخلی امروز آسیب‌زاتر از تحریم‌های خارجی شده‌اند.

title: هشتمین روز از بازی‌های آسیایی جوانان در بحرین
ناخالصی های موادمخدر کُشنده تر است
summary: مدیر گروه علوم آزمایشگاهی گفت: ناخالصی‌های موجود در مواد مخدر، مانند افزودن فلز سرب به تریاک، می‌تواند از خود ماده مخدر خطرناک‌تر باشد و موجب بروز مسمومیت حاد یا حتی مرگ شود.

title: احداث ۴۲۸ کلاس درس جدید در استان سمنان
summary: سمنان- سرپرست سازمان نوسازی مدارس استان سمنان از اجرای ۵۵ پروژه مدرسه‌سازی با ۴۲۸ کلاس درس در این استان خبر داد. این پروژه‌ها در راستای توسعه و ارتقای فضای آموزشی استان اجرا می‌شوند.
